alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:11PM CDT until April 14 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Pepin and Dunn Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact low lying areas...and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM CDT Monday, the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.4 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 05/29/2012. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
